bibl.title: Letter from J.G. Perry to Henry Rose Carter, April 30, 1918

div1.p: Perry sends Carter to Camp Merritt, New Jersey, for anti-malaria work

div1.head: Letter from J.G. Perry to Henry Rose Carter, April 30, 1918
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
CD
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
April 30, 1918.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
226 High Street,
Portsmouth, Va.
Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to your letter of the 26th instant, there is
confirmed Bureau telegram of the 29th instant, reading as
follows:

“Carter, 226 High Street, Portsmouth, Va.
Proceed Camp Merritt after completion Portsmouth work.
BLUE”

Authority for your expenses in proceeding to New Jersey
for the supervision of antimalaria work is contained in your
orders of March 28, 1918.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, JG Perry
Acting Surgeon General. J.W.S.
